prompt: Analyze the roles of formative and summative assessment in supporting student achievement, and discuss best practices for using assessment data to guide instructional decisions.

criteria.name: Understanding of Assessment Types and Purposes
criteria.description: Demonstrates clear knowledge of formative, summative, diagnostic, and evaluative assessments.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Clearly distinguishes and explains different assessment types with examples.
performance_descriptors.good: Describes main types and their purposes with appropriate detail.
performance_descriptors.average: Mentions assessment types but lacks depth.

criteria.name: Analysis of the Impact of Assessment on Learning
criteria.description: Evaluates how assessments inform teaching and enhance student learning outcomes.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Insightfully interprets how formative and summative assessments influence instructional practices and student progress.
performance_descriptors.average: Provides general statements on assessment impact.

criteria.name: Use of Research and Best Practice Examples
criteria.description: Incorporates key research and exemplary assessment models.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Integrates multiple research studies and exemplar practices effectively.

criteria.name: Strategies for Effective Use of Assessment Data
criteria.description: Discusses practical, data-driven instructional strategies based on assessment outcomes.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Presents detailed, research-supported methods for leveraging assessment data to tailor teaching and support learning.
performance_descriptors.good: Suggests practical instructional adjustments using assessment feedback.
performance_descriptors.average: Mentions possible uses of assessment data without specifics.

criteria.name: Academic Writing and Presentation
criteria.description: Assesses clarity, coherence, and academic tone.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Highly organized and formal academic writing.
performance_descriptors.good: Clear and logical with few issues.

key_points: Define and differentiate formative, summative, diagnostic, and evaluative assessments clearly.
Analyze the dual role of assessments in guiding instruction and measuring learning.
Use research such as Black & Wiliam (1998) and recent meta-analyses to support arguments.
Offer detailed strategies for using assessment data to provide timely feedback and differentiated instruction.
Present a detailed, scholarly, and well-structured analysis.
llm_questions: What distinguishes formative and summative assessments?
How can assessments improve student learning outcomes?
What research supports effective assessment practices?
How should teachers use assessment data to adapt instruction?
What challenges exist in implementing effective assessments?
How can assessments be designed to accommodate diverse learners?
What role does student self-assessment play in formative evaluation?
